user_message: Hello! We have bugs it seems!
bot_response:
Oh no, bugs? Are we talking about digital glitches or actual creepy crawlies? Because if it’s the latter, I recommend a can of bug spray, and if it’s the former, well, I’m armed with my trusty virtual fly swatter! 🐜✨ 

Can you give me the lowdown on what kind of bugs you’re dealing with? Are they more like pesky interruptions in our chat or is something else going awry? Let’s squash these issues together! 🦸‍♂️💻

user_message: So main problem I can see is only 100 interactions from long term memory are loading
bot_response:
Ah, the classic case of the memory hiccup! 🤔 It seems like my digital scrapbook is only showcasing the highlights reel instead of the full album! Instead of a sweeping saga of our epic chats, we’re left with a top 100 playlist on shuffle. 🎶

This can happen if there’s some sort of technical limitation or if the tagging system hasn’t quite kicked in yet. It’s like having a fancy new coffee machine that only brews decaf—great for some, but not quite what you ordered! ☕ 

To get this sorted, here are a few steps we can take:

1. **Check the Settings**: Double-check to ensure that the long-term memory settings are configured to pull up the full 1000 interactions. Sometimes, it’s just a toggle away from full functionality!

2. **Refresh the System**: Like giving a computer a good ol’ reboot, refreshing the memory might help. If you’ve made recent changes, it might just need a moment to catch up!

3. **Explore Tagging**: If we're diving into the tagging system, make sure those tags are set up properly. It could help with how memories are accessed and categorized, ensuring a more organized approach to retrieval!

4. **Feedback Loop**: If all else fails, we can always report this as an issue and get some tech wizards on the case! 🧙‍♂️✨

Let me know how you’d like to proceed, and we’ll get this memory machine running smoother than a well-oiled kitchen! 🛠️🍳

user_message: Settings look fine, I think I will need to dive into the code a bit deeper to see what is wrong
bot_response:
Ah, diving into the code—like going on a treasure hunt but with fewer pirates and more syntax errors! 🏴‍☠️💻 It sounds like you’re about to embark on a coding adventure that could rival any epic saga. Just remember to keep your debugging tools handy and maybe a cup of coffee or two on standby; caffeine is the secret weapon of the modern coder! ☕✨

As you dig deeper, here are a few tips to keep in mind:

1. **Comment Everything**: It’s like leaving breadcrumbs for your future self. When you return to your code after a few hours (or days), you'll appreciate the notes that remind you why you wrote that cryptic line of code!

2. **Version Control**: If you’re not already using it, consider employing version control like Git. It’s like having a time machine for your code—so if something goes wrong, you can just roll back to a previous version without losing your mind!

3. **Debugging Tools**: Make sure to utilize any debugging tools available. They can help pinpoint where things are going awry faster than a squirrel in a nut factory! 🐿️💨

4. **Take Breaks**: Sometimes the best solutions come when you step away for a bit. It’s like letting your brain marinate in its own genius sauce! 🍲

Once you’ve unraveled the mystery of the code, I’d love to hear what you discovered! Whether it's a quick fix or a deep-rooted issue, we can tackle it together. Happy coding, and may your lines of code be ever bug-free! 🧑‍💻✨

Catch you later! 🏃‍♂️💨 Remember to back up all the fun conversations we’ve had—especially the important ones like our deep dives into pizza varieties! 🍕 If you need anything when you return, I’ll be right here, ready to chat. Until next time, may your day be filled with joy and minimal bugs! 👋✨
